document_data.name: Tarmock Felaskur
document_data.mainbody: '''Tarmock Felaskur''' was the [[apothecary]] in [[Triboar]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Activities: Tarmock sold medicines and remedies out of his [[Apothecary (Triboar)|apothecary shop]]. His goods were known to be largely ineffective, and so he made most of his money selling [[sweet water (beverage)|sweet water]], a naturally sweet and carbonated water that bubbled up from a small spring concealed in the shed behind his house.
document_data.Relationships: Tarmock supplied most of his sweet water to a local restaurant called The [[Pleasing Platter]]. This one business relationship was his primary source of sales.
